summary: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable tax credit for certain home accessibility improvements. The credit is equal to 35% of qualified home accessibility expenditures up to $10,000 per year, with a lifetime limit of $30,000.  The bill outlines qualified individuals and improvements, including ramps, grab bars, widening doorways, and modifications for appliances.  Income limitations and inflation adjustments are included. The Secretary of the Treasury is instructed to issue guidance and conduct outreach. Includes a GAO study and report.
